tn.text: AT: "Solomon exercised great power over Israel"
This is the name of God that he revealed to his people in the Old Testament. See the translationWord page about Yahweh concerning how to translate this.
AT: "God supported him" or "God helped him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
A little town about 9 miles west of Jersulem. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur
up there to the bronze altar
tn.text: Solomon went to Gibeon where the altar was at the tent of meeting.

tn.ref: a people as numerous as the dust of the earth
who can judge your people, who are so many in number?
tn.text: AT: "no one can judge all of your countless people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: from before the tent of meeting

tn.text: This is a reference to cities which stored his chariots.

tn.ref: silver and gold as common in Jerusalem as the stones
tn.text: AT: "rare and valuable metals to be abundant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: cedar wood as common as the sycamore trees that are in the lowlands
tn.text: AT: "rare and valuable imported wood to be abundant"
AT: "brought in goods from outside the country"
Some think that Kue was in Cilicia, in Asia Minor. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
AT: "at a set price" or "for money"
They sold goods produced in Israel to other countries.
